result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle R Baars was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kyle R Baars is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kyle R Baars was found guilty of Misconduct/Office-Fail/Perform KnownDuty, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.12(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided)
** Pay DNA surcharge.  Perform 80 hours of communtiy service work for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.    May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Probation may be transferred to Illinois.

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney James Martin appears for the State. Defendant, Kyle R Baars, appeared with Attorney Mark D. Richards.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Court imposes and stays 2 years in the WSP with 1 year Initial Confinement followed by 1 year Extended Supervision. Eligible for CIP, but not SAP.    Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions and probation may be transferred to Illinois.  As a condition he is ordered to complete 80 hours of community service.  Court costs & DNA surcharge ordered and to be paid during supervision.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Atty James Martin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant, Kyle R Baars, appeared with Attorney Mark D. Richards.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved. Count 1 - Dismissed by the State.  Count 2 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the Court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
2015AP2389-CRLV.  Court of Appeals certified copy of order denying petition for leave to appeal dated 12/29/15.

Atty James Martin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def. appeared with Atty Mark Richards.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case is not resolved.  Jury status hearing remains on for 4/14/16 at 1:00 and for jury trial on 4/18/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.
2015AP2389-CRLV.  Dated 12/29/15 - IT IS ORDERED that the petition for leave to appeal is denied without costs.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the request for a stay is denied as moot.
